segments.text: We came too early . There're still three hours before the performance starts .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know . Sorry , I shouldn't have rushed you , but I just couldn't stay at home and wait .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Never mind . What about taking a look around the theater ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why not ? I'd love to do that .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Here we go . There is a museum of the Beijing Opera art . ( They come to the museum of the Beijing Opera art . )
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wow . Look at this . So delicate and beautiful . Did ancient Chinese people really wear them ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Not really . They are just opera costumes . Do you like the embroidery ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I surely do . They must have had advanced machines in ancient China to do that .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , no , no . They are all handmade , girl . You know , the ancient Chinese women were supposed to be good at needlework .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Unbelievable ! I could never do that .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Very few can . That's why these clothes only appear in the museum .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Listen ! Some people are singing outside . Is it the opera ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , yes . I heard there was an opera fans club . They are probably practicing now . Wanna have a look ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Follow me . Make sure not to interrupt them .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Of course not . We don't do that .
